meanings.definition: Stand, move, or sit in a lazy, drooping way.
meanings.sent1: He slouches in his chair while watching TV.
meanings.sent2: She always slouches when she's tired.
meanings.sent3: The cat slouches lazily in the sunbeam.
meanings.sent4: The tree slouches under the weight of the snow.
meanings.sent5: The student slouches in class, barely paying attention.

meanings.sent1: Don't be a slouches, get up and do your work.
meanings.sent2: The boss fired the slouches who never did their tasks.
meanings.sent3: The slouches at the office always takes long breaks.
meanings.sent4: The team lost because they had too many slouches on it.
meanings.sent5: The slouches never contribute anything to the group project.
